title: Relates to trapping license to trap snapping turtles
summary: Relates to trapping license to trap snapping turtles.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          378

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. MAGEE -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Environmental Conservation

       AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to snap-
         ping turtles; and providing for the repeal  of  such  provisions  upon
         expiration thereof

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 10 of  section  11-0701  of  the  environmental
    2  conservation  law,  as  amended by chapter 57 of the laws of 1993 and as
    3  renumbered by chapter 470 of the laws of 1994, is  amended  to  read  as
    4  follows:
    5    10.  A  trapping  license  entitles  the holder to trap beaver, otter,
    6  fisher, mink, muskrat, skunk, raccoon,  bobcat,  coyote,  fox,  opossum,
    7  weasel,  pine  marten, SNAPPING TURTLES, and unprotected wildlife except
    8  birds, as  provided  in  title  11  OF  THIS  ARTICLE,  subject  to  the
    9  provisions of subdivision [6] 3 of section 11-0713 of this article.
   10    S  2.  Paragraph c of subdivision 3 of section 11-0901 of the environ-
   11  mental conservation law, as amended by chapter 825 of the laws  of  1973
   12  and  subparagraph  1  as  amended by chapter 407 of the laws of 1976, is
   13  amended to read as follows:
   14    c. Wild small game and wild upland game birds shall be taken  only  by
   15  longbow or gun, or by the use of raptors as provided in title 10 of this
   16  article, except that:
   17    (1) skunk, raccoon, bobcat, coyote, fox, mink and muskrat may be taken
   18  in any manner not prohibited in this section or in title 11 of [the Fish
   19  and Wildlife Law] THIS ARTICLE, and
   20    (2) frogs AND SNAPPING TURTLES may also be taken by spearing, catching
   21  with the hands, or by the use of a club, NET, POLE or hook, AND SNAPPING
   22  TURTLES  MAY  ALSO  BE  TAKEN BY TRAPPING PURSUANT TO TITLES 7 AND 11 OF
   23  THIS ARTICLE.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03571-01-1

       A. 378                              2

    1    S 3. Subdivision 1 of section 11-1103 of the  environmental  conserva-
    2  tion  law,  as amended by chapter 911 of the laws of 1990, is amended to
    3  read as follows:
    4    1. The department may by regulation permit trapping of beaver, fisher,
    5  otter,  bobcat,  coyote,  fox, raccoon, opossum, weasel, skunk, muskrat,
    6  pine marten [and], mink, SNAPPING TURTLES, or any of them, in  specified
    7  areas,  and  may regulate the taking, possession and disposition of such
    8  animals.  The periods in which trapping of such animals is so  permitted
    9  are open seasons for the trapping of the species for which the period is
   10  fixed, in the area or areas for which it is so fixed.
   11    S  4.  This  act shall take effect immediately and shall expire and be
   12  deemed repealed on and after September 30, 2014.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to snapping turtles; and providing for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof
